text: Hi!  We used this "/extensions/ecomm/v2/sync/messages" endpoint for a while but it seems to be deprecated now. It had a lot of pros like the direct way to associate and create deals, contacts and line_items. As is looks like to me, one request with the old endpoint is now 2 with the new ones.  First create a deal, get the contactId, and associate the contact with the deal. Is there any way to achieve direct associations at creation with the new endpoints or do I have to make extra association requests for every object? thx for any help :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi guys, short question. Is there a possibility to receive a notification e.g. via mail in case of an incorrect API request (e.g. HTTP code 400)?   Greetings and thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
Per HubSpot or do u have code which executes the api requests? If yes, which programming language?

Thank you for your feedback. We use the "Search Endpoint" to check if a contact already exists. If not, we create a new contact. This usually works fine. However, sometimes the "Search Endpoint" does not find an existing contact even though it exists with the given email address. In this case, we try to create the contact, but this results in an error because the contact already exists. We are using php :disappointed:  ... So since we cannot explain this error, it would be helpful if we received a notification from HubSpot when an endpoint, for example, throws a 400 error code. If this is at all possible.
Thank you Sir! Creating a new Private App fixed the issue.

Hi guys, now that EComm Bridge API is deprecated, how can I create a new E-Commerce Store and associate objects like Contacts with it. Also I created custom field mapping for products and deals, how can I do that now? Thanks
<@U01QVR44MEY> One of our clients asks us to move Contacts 'Activities' data from one portal to another. I don't know if is it possible. Is there any way to do that either with API or without API?
take a look at the new docs. There is now a dedicated association api. With that you can associate deals, contacts etc. Havent worked with field mapping so far though

use a try catch method :slightly_smiling_face:  though the email should be a unique identifier. In my code it works without flaws to check a contact via mail. With try catch u can catch the exception and send it via smtp server or mail provider to you. You can save the request response aswell and check the status code. if statuscode == 400 or whatever your status code is, send an email
ok thx

In middle of migrating from API Key to Private App - for some reason the view we were able to see last week under Integrations > API Key where we could still see old API Keys (and usage) is no longer visible. Did something happen? We want to verify no calls are still going to the old key and to delete/disable the old key now that the new one should be in place for the new Private App.
We have verified that the calls via the new Private App are going through, but had a decent number of things may have been using the old key and we want to see if any calls still going through
Tried asking via Support chat, but they were not able to help
(First time in this Slack so if this is the wrong place for this - just let me know!)
That i know. I need help with Custom ECommerce Store creation and association of object with that store. It used to be created to with deprecated ECom bridge api
<@UFBNA9K9A> maybe you know?

So it's not impossible to move those activities over through an bulk export, basically you can get most of those activities through the engagements api: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/communications> and then you can create them on your other portal

Hey guys,

I am just wondering. Is there a *webhook* for uninstalling public integration events? :thinking_face:
It would be nice to remove integration-related files from a client’s portal if they decide to remove my app.
Thanks mate :+1:
of course
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Notification-or-webhook-for-marketplace-uninstall/td-p/369218>
It's been a request for a little bit now, still not possible
one thing you might look at doing is track the uninstall survey submissions <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/integration-exit-survey-and-app-partner-survey-export>
Nice

Unfortunately I don't know if there's an endpoint for app survery submissions, also you could just ping the oauth information api (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth/tokens>) every couple of hours to check if the integration is still active
The problem I am facing is that we can’t clean up app-related files if we don’t have valid tokens after removing our app from a client’s portal.
Thank you <@U01QVR44MEY> for all your efforts to help me
The files are on the client's HubSpot?
yes
Ok now I understand

you can try our app
<https://voice.kohorta.co/>

I would suggest creating a settings page for your app that has a button called click here before uninstalling, this will then fire a webhook to your server and let it know that it needs to remove all the files
I'm looking for a couple of other ways to do it one moment
Yeah, this is probably the only feasible way.

And if this ever came to fruition then this uninstall button could actually uninstall your app <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Programmatic-Removal-of-App-from-a-Portal/m-p/224394>
Hi <@U01QVR44MEY>, actually I have one more question for you. Can we copy workflow from one HubSpot account to another?
You can for contact based workflows, get a workflow and then use that response to create the workflow <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/create-manage-workflows>
Ok. Thanks. I will surely try this tomorrow morning.
Sounds good let me know how it goes
Thats awesome, thanks
for sure, let me know if you find something different?
That’s what we were going to setup for sentry lol
hahaha
not the worst solution but also not the greatest
or you could pull a <@U02BW35KW7J> and just copy the sentry npm into the custom code

Hi Guys,
I am using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|CustomWorkflowAction> in HubSpot, Will I be able to send the api-key given by action user in headers along with the call made to actionURL and call made to optionsFetchURL?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions#using-external-data>
But it won't be sent through as a header
Yup, defaulted to 12 pm GMT time. I'm glad I dont need to backup and backfill the values now haha
does anyone have a solution?
What information do you have?
that would help you identity the user?
what exactly are you trying to accomplish

Hi <@U01QVR44MEY>
we have a phone system, and people want to integrate it with there HubSpot account, so i direct them to HubSpot oauth with my clientId, and a redirect to my api to get the code from HubSpot, then i exchange the code to get the access and refresh tokens, and save it to my database, now when a user wants topost a phone call to HubSpot with the HubSpot  all engagement api, how can I get the users HubSpot ownerId to add it to the post for the user who posts the call?

thanks
Yeah, no problem you can grab the owner id from the contacts api (assuming that you're making phone calls to HubSpot contacts)
Let me know if you need more info
I can hop on a call with you tomorrow and work through it

Hi :slightly_smiling_face: Does anyone know if the ids from creating a line_items batch are all consecutive? I want to assoociate them to deals and if they are, I can just get the first and last id and iterate through
